content:
• Tuesday, October 9, 2012
  • FOE

    Ferro (NYSE:FOE) -8.5% AH after warning it expects 2012 EPS of $0.07-$0.12, below a $0.17...

    Ferro (NYSE:FOE) -8.5% AH after warning it expects 2012 EPS of $0.07-$0.12, below a $0.17 consensus. The company blames weakness in its solar pastes and metal powders businesses - the former saw a $0.14-$0.17/share loss. Ferro adds it's "exploring strategic options" for its solar pastes business, which has been hit hard by the solar industry's pricing and overcapacity issues, and plans to take impairment charges of $175M-$200M.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM
  • CMI

    Shares of several heavy equipment makers are sliding on weak guidance from Cummins (CMI -4.8%...

    Shares of several heavy equipment makers are sliding on weak guidance from Cummins (CMI -4.8% AH): CAT -1.8%, DE -0.9%, ETN -1.9%, ITW -0.2%, NAV -3.1%, PCAR -3.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM | 3 Comments
  • CMI

    Cummins (NYSE:CMI) -6.2% AH after issuing downside guidance for Q3 and FY12, citing weak demand....

    Cummins (NYSE:CMI) -6.2% AH after issuing downside guidance for Q3 and FY12, citing weak demand. For Q3, CMI expects revenues of $4.1B vs. $4.42B analyst consensus. FY12 revenue outlook is cut to ~$17B vs. prior guidance of $18B and $18.13B consensus. EBIT is seen at ~13.5% for the year vs. prior guidance of 14.25%-14.75%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • XSPA

    After a volatile day featuring trading volume over 5x higher than average, Vringo (VRNG -18%)...

    After a volatile day featuring trading volume over 5x higher than average, Vringo (VRNG -18%) closed with big losses, as trading ended without a Google settlement announced. A short-lived afternoon rally was attributed to a report of a settlement that would up being discredited, though some remain intrigued by the fact the Vringo-Google trial (set for an Oct. 16 start) no longer appears on a court docket. The fact Vringo's stock offering closed today may have contributed to the volatility.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 23 Comments
  • CVX

    Chevron (NYSE:CVX) issues a Q3 interim update, projecting lower upstream and downstream results...

    Chevron (NYSE:CVX) issues a Q3 interim update, projecting lower upstream and downstream results Q/Q. In the first two months of Q3, U.S. net oil-equivalent production fell 19K bbl/day Q/Q, largely from Hurricane Isaac; U.S. refinery crude-input volumes fell 92K bbl/day, mostly from the shutdown of the Richmond, Calif., refinery unit, which is expected to remain offline through Q4. CVX -1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:18 PM
  • YUM

    More Yum Brands' FQ3: Same-store sales +6% Y/Y in both China and the U.S., YRI markets +2%....

    More Yum Brands' FQ3: Same-store sales +6% Y/Y in both China and the U.S., YRI markets +2%. Total Chinese sales +23% Y/Y, but YRI markets -2% and U.S. +1%. Indian sales +29% (exc. forex). Global restaurant margin rose 190 bps Y/Y to 18.9%, boosted by a 460 bps increase in the U.S. division's margin to 16.7%. China now has 4,952 "traditional restaurants" (+18% Y/Y) and 4,043 KFC locations (+16%). $414M in shares repurchased. YUM +3.6% AH. CC tomorrow at 9:15AM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • EQC

    CommonWealth REIT (NYSE:CWH) declares $0.25/share quarterly dividend, 50% decrease from prior...

    CommonWealth REIT (NYSE:CWH) declares $0.25/share quarterly dividend, 50% decrease from prior dividend of $0.50. Forward yield 6.8%. For shareholders of record Oct 22. Payable Nov 21. Ex-div date Oct 18. Shares -3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 6 Comments
  • YUM

    Yum! Brands, Inc. (NYSE:YUM): Q3 EPS of $0.99 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $3.57B (+9% Y/Y) misses...

    Yum! Brands, Inc. (NYSE:YUM): Q3 EPS of $0.99 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $3.57B (+9% Y/Y) misses by $70M. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU -19.9%) +2.7% AH after reaffirming its Q3 revenue guidance of $20.25M-$21.25M...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU -19.9%) +2.7% AH after reaffirming its Q3 revenue guidance of $20.25M-$21.25M (consensus stands at $21.4M), and guiding for adjusted EBITDA slightly above prior guidance of -$3.1M to -$4M. However, the company admits none of the 11 mobile games it launched in Q3 were "breakout title launches," and some failed to meet expectations. Shares were crushed today after Northland Securities suggested management is disappointed with Q3 game launches. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • AA

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA): FQ3 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $5.8B beats by $200M. Shares +1%...

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA): FQ3 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $5.8B beats by $200M. Shares +1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 17 Comments
  • CLI

    Mack-Cali Realty (CLI +2%) agrees to buy certain assets from Roseland Partners for ~$134M, as...

    Mack-Cali Realty (CLI +2%) agrees to buy certain assets from Roseland Partners for ~$134M, as the REIT looks to diversify its portfolio. CLI will buy Roseland's real estate development and management businesses, as well as interests in six operating multifamily properties, one condo-residential property and four commercial properties.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • CNX

    Goldman Sachs is bullish on Consol Energy (CNX +5.2%) and Peabody Energy (BTU +6.4%) even as it...

    Goldman Sachs is bullish on Consol Energy (CNX +5.2%) and Peabody Energy (BTU +6.4%) even as it downgrades Arch Coal (ACI +4.3%), giving a boost to coal mining stocks (KOL +1.8%). The firm says the duo are set to benefit from a rebound in spot prices, which it thinks are currently at "unsustainable" levels. Also: ANR +7.3%, WLT +7.9%, JRCC +9.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • CBNRQ

    Cubic Energy (QBC +1.8%) will receive $12.2M through a settlement with Tauren Exploration, Exco...

    Cubic Energy (QBC +1.8%) will receive $12.2M through a settlement with Tauren Exploration, Exco Operating and BG U.S. Production, and says it will use $9.1M to pay down debt, according to an SEC filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • NFX

    Newfield Energy (NFX +6.3%) surges to the top of the S&P 500 leader board after Continental...

    Newfield Energy (NFX +6.3%) surges to the top of the S&P 500 leader board after Continental Resources (CLR +3.6%) announces a shale oil discovery in Oklahoma may add 1.8B boe of crude to CLR’s reserves and is geologically similar to the Bakken region (earlier). NFX owns ~135K net acres in the Cana Woodford project near CLR’s discovery.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • SVU

    Shares of Supervalu (SVU -7.7%) trade lower in what could be a reaction to chatter that Wal-Mart...

    Shares of Supervalu (SVU -7.7%) trade lower in what could be a reaction to chatter that Wal-Mart (NYSE:WMT) will unveil more details about a plan to expand its small stores concept at an investor meeting tomorrow. Although Wal-Mart's ambitions for mini-stores in large metropolitan areas appears to be only small in scope at the moment, it could still be of concern to grocery stores in the future. Watching the trend: KR, SWY, WFM, DEG.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG -6.4%) has been volatile in trading today, as investors wait to hear the results of...

    Vringo (VRNG -6.4%) has been volatile in trading today, as investors wait to hear the results of both a Vringo motion for sanctions against Google, and court-ordered settlement talks between the companies. Shares were down as much as 15% before briefly turning positive, and then selling off again.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 7 Comments
  • LXK

    Lexmark (LXK -5.2%) and Dell (DELL-OLD -2.6%) underperform after Citi starts each company at...

    Lexmark (LXK -5.2%) and Dell (DELL-OLD -2.6%) underperform after Citi starts each company at Sell as part of a broader IT hardware coverage launch. Citi is worried about the impact of the bring-your-own-device trend (favors Macs over Windows systems) on Dell, which is near multi-year lows once again.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (APKT -5.6%) slumps after MetroPCS (PCS) discloses it won't be deploying...

    Acme Packet (APKT -5.6%) slumps after MetroPCS (PCS) discloses it won't be deploying voice-over-LTE (VoLTE) following its merger with T-Mobile USA. VoLTE is seen as a major future demand driver for Acme's session border controllers - Acme shares fell in August after Raymond James claimed AT&T and Verizon are delaying their VoLTE deployment plans. Also, BMO has started coverage with a Market Perform.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • MNK

    Heavily-shorted Questcor (QCOR +6.1%) surges after receiving more positive sell-side commentary...

    Heavily-shorted Questcor (QCOR +6.1%) surges after receiving more positive sell-side commentary (previous), this time from Jefferies, which is upgrading shares to Buy. Analyst Biren Amin believes investors are pricing Questcor as if almost no insurers will provide coverage for its Acthar gel for treating nephrotic syndrome or MS, something he considers unrealistic.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • MWW

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW -6.3%) give back more ground as trading on the name continues...

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW -6.3%) give back more ground as trading on the name continues to be dominated by speculation on whether or not a buyer will finally emerge to snap up the online postings company.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • ALLT

    An upgrade from Jefferies helps Allot (ALLT +3.3%) to trade higher on a bad day for tech....

    An upgrade from Jefferies helps Allot (ALLT +3.3%) to trade higher on a bad day for tech. Jefferies believes Verizon will place initial orders for Allot's hardware in Q4 (revenues in 2013), and thinks demand for its traffic management gear will remain strong since it helps carriers monetize 4G investments (presumably by allowing them to analyze/prioritize traffic and control download speeds). ThinkEquity recently argued tiered broadband plans will boost demand for Allot and Procera's (NYSEMKT:PKT) hardware.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • ARCH

    Arch Coal (ACI +2.6%) pushes higher even after Goldman Sachs downgrades shares to Sell,...

    Arch Coal (ACI +2.6%) pushes higher even after Goldman Sachs downgrades shares to Sell, expecting ACI will be forced to cut met coal growth guidance. Coal, iron ore and steel stocks are strong for a second straight day following news that iron ore prices in China rose 6% to $110.40/ton. ANR +5.3%, AKS +3.9%, WLT +3.7%, BTU +3.6%, X +3.1%, CLF +2.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • PRSN

    Midday top 10 gainers: BSDM +73%. OTCPK:ALDA +28%. APPY +22%. OTC:RITT +19%. OTT +17%. TRT +17%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: BSDM +73%. OTCPK:ALDA +28%. APPY +22%. OTC:RITT +19%. OTT +17%. TRT +17%. HOLL +15%. PRPH +13%. PBM +13%. BIOF +12%.
    Top 10 Losers: VDSI-OLD -23%. MGT -22%. EW -19%. THM -19%. GLUU -18%. PVA -16%. PAMT -15%. ANGO -13%. VRNG -11%. UNIS -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • PXD

    Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +1.8%) is initiated at Outperform by Wells Fargo, which believes...

    Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +1.8%) is initiated at Outperform by Wells Fargo, which believes its core Permian and Eagle Ford assets offer investors "exposure to a steady, low-risk asset base, a liquids-weighted production profile, and a repeatable and visible inventory of opportunities to fuel growth for years to come."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • WWW

    Shares of Wolverine World Wide (WWW +2.1%) jump higher after the retailer lifts profit estimates...

    Shares of Wolverine World Wide (WWW +2.1%) jump higher after the retailer lifts profit estimates for the next two years. After factoring in the effect from its just-completed purchase of operations from Collective Brands, the company adds a dime to EPS forecasts for 2013 and 2014 and says accretion generated from the deal will be greater than originally expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • HNRG

    Hallador Energy (HNRG +8.5%) is initiated with a Buy rating at Brean Murray, which sees the...

    Hallador Energy (HNRG +8.5%) is initiated with a Buy rating at Brean Murray, which sees the pure‐play Illinois Basin coal producer gaining on several favorable fundamental drivers. HNRG is "structurally well positioned in one of the most attractive domestic thermal coal basins, has lower costs than its peers, and trades at a more compelling valuation," the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • EXK

    Endeavour Silver (EXK -4.5%) reports an illegal work stoppage at the El Cubo mine in Mexico,...

    Endeavour Silver (EXK -4.5%) reports an illegal work stoppage at the El Cubo mine in Mexico, which has blocked access to certain facilities held under lease near the mine. EXK says mine operations haven't been interrupted and union workers continue to produce and stockpile ore as usual.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW -4.7%) sells off after OTR Global claims Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) new...

    VMware (VMW -4.7%) sells off after OTR Global claims Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) new virtualization and management software products are hurting VMware's sales. The latest version of Microsoft's Hyper-V virtualization platform, recently launched as a part of Windows Server 2012, has received favorable reviews, and so has an update to Microsoft's System Center management software. But the huge enterprise investments made in VMware's vSphere platform make it hard to dislodge.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 5 Comments
  • PVAC

    Penn Virginia (PVA -14.4%) plunges after announcing concurrent public offerings of 12M shares of...

    Penn Virginia (PVA -14.4%) plunges after announcing concurrent public offerings of 12M shares of common stock and $50M of depositary shares representing convertible preferred equity. PVA intends to use net proceeds to repay debt and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (PAY -6.6%) trades lower with reports out tipping off that mobile payments upstart...

    VeriFone (PAY -6.6%) trades lower with reports out tipping off that mobile payments upstart Square is closing in on finalizing a deal to equip close to a thousand New York City taxis with its devices. The battle for NYC cabs between Verifone and Square heated up over the last few months with Mayor Bloomberg even spotted testing Square's credit card reader for himself recently.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR +5.6%) reaffirms 2012 guidance and continues to estimate 2012 production...

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR +5.6%) reaffirms 2012 guidance and continues to estimate 2012 production of 2.9M-3.1M boe. GPOR expects the Boy Scout 1-33H well to begin flowing into a sales pipeline by mid-November and to have six additional wells brought online by year's end.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +1.6%) shares are climbing, perhaps driven by news that Britain's Noble...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +1.6%) shares are climbing, perhaps driven by news that Britain's Noble Clean Fuels signed an agreement to import spare liquefied natural gas. Cheniere often benefits from news of higher LNG import demands since it is the only company with a full export terminal permit.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU -19.9%) crashes following a critical note from Northland Securities. The firm...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU -19.9%) crashes following a critical note from Northland Securities. The firm says conversations with management lead it to believe the company is disappointed with its Q3 game launches, and sees this limiting smartphone revenue upside. Glu fell on Friday in sympathy with Zynga.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 6 Comments
  • HA

    Shares of Hawaiian Holdings (HA -4.9%) stumble after the company lowers its Q3 guidance along...

    Shares of Hawaiian Holdings (HA -4.9%) stumble after the company lowers its Q3 guidance along with its report on September traffic. The carrier now sees passenger revenue per ASM falling between 6.2% and 5.2% as its capacity gains around 28%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU -3.8%) falls after receiving yet another downgrade, this time from Credit Suisse....

    Baidu (BIDU -3.8%) falls after receiving yet another downgrade, this time from Credit Suisse. The firm, which now rates Baidu an Underperform, expects estimates to move lower thanks to stronger competition (no doubt from Qihoo), a weaker-than-expected ad market, and mobile monetization challenges. (prior downgrades: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • VDSI-OLD

    Vasco Data Security (VDSI-OLD -23.7%) gets clobbered following its warning - not only is...

    Vasco Data Security (VDSI-OLD -23.7%) gets clobbered following its warning - not only is expected Q3 revenue of $36M below a $42.9M consensus, the authentication hardware/software firm's 2012 revenue guidance ($150M-$157M vs. consensus of $171M) implies Q4 will also be soft. Given this is the is the second big warning this year from Vasco (previous), which has heavy European exposure, the Street isn't in a forgiving mood. (possible MSFT competition)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • LLY

    Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) may have jumped 5.3% yesterday and added $3B to its market cap following...

    Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) may have jumped 5.3% yesterday and added $3B to its market cap following news that its Solanezumab drug helped slow the progress of Alzheimer's Disease in Phase III trials, but SA author Brian Wilson points out that "the results were not statistically significant." This means that the study can't be used for an NDA submission of solanezumab, which is therefore "not going to make it to...market."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -2.4%) slides after Jefferies' Peter Misek claims BlackBerry 10 won't...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -2.4%) slides after Jefferies' Peter Misek claims BlackBerry 10 won't launch until March - RIM has only promised BB10 devices will be available at some point in Q1. Also, Misek says "checks point to a tough November quarter," as channel partners cut back on inventory, and is skeptical RIM will find a buyer.(previous) (more on BB10)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM | 4 Comments
  • ROYL

    Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL) +7.1% premarket after providing new operational details on Great Bear's...

    Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL) +7.1% premarket after providing new operational details on Great Bear's plans to accelerate testing and production on its North Slope acreage. Great Bear has applied to amend its plan of operations to extend a proposed production flow test from 15 days to up to 180 days and to drill an additional well at the Alcor pad.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • GMCR

    Keybanc is out with a defense of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR), calling a new...

    Keybanc is out with a defense of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR), calling a new partnership with Dr. Pepper Snapple to sell ice tea K-cup packets significant. The new iced beverage lines join other products from the company geared toward broadening the reach of Keurig machines outside of coffee, a goal that brings in its shares of skepticism from industry insiders. GMCR +3.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 2 Comments

  • Market preview: Futures are flat-to-higher after the IMF cuts its global outlook and ahead of...

    Market preview: Futures are flat-to-higher after the IMF cuts its global outlook and ahead of the start of earnings season later with Alcoa, with the S&P benchmark almost unchanged. However, oil is +1.1% on increasing tension between Turkey and Syria. In corporate news, Spectrum Brands is +11.6% after agreeing to buy a Black & Decker unit for $1.4B, although Edwards Lifesciences is -17% and Owens Cornings is -7.2% following earnings warnings. Later: Employment Trends Index, IBD/TIPP Economic Optimism
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • NFLX

    More Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) pain: Google updated its Google TV platform with new features that...

    More Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) pain: Google updated its Google TV platform with new features that will allow users to buy and rent movies more easily from the Play Store. (Previous: BofA downgrade, data tracking weak) NFLX -6.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • RSH

    Premarket gainers: RSH +11%. EMXX +10%. QCOR +7%. NAVB +6%. Losers: EW -17%. ATHX -14%. OC -7%....

    Premarket gainers: RSH +11%. EMXX +10%. QCOR +7%. NAVB +6%.
    Losers: EW -17%. ATHX -14%. OC -7%. NFLX -7%. ALU -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 3 Comments
  • SPB

    Shares of Spectrum Brands (NYSE:SPB) jump 9.5% higher in premarket action after the company...

    Shares of Spectrum Brands (NYSE:SPB) jump 9.5% higher in premarket action after the company snaps up a unit of Black & Decker that makes household products such as bathroom fixtures and door locks. The squeeze play could be on with short interest on the name running relatively high.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • NFLX

    Shares of Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) retreat 3.8% premarket after SunTrust warns tracking data will...

    Shares of Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) retreat 3.8% premarket after SunTrust warns tracking data will show September usage trends weakened. A downgrade from Bank of America on the name to Sell from Buy is also tipping sentiment.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM | 1 Comment

  • RadioShack catches an upgrade from Bank of America to Buy with an upped price target of $2.50....

    RadioShack catches an upgrade from Bank of America to Buy with an upped price target of $2.50. Analysts with the firm see an attractive buying point after a wave of negative news drove shares lower. They note that the electronics seller now trades at just 5X its inventory and accounts receivables total. RSH +10.1% to $2.29 premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM | 1 Comment

  • EU stocks add to yesterday's losses and fall in early trading, possibly on the IMF's pessimism...

    EU stocks add to yesterday's losses and fall in early trading, possibly on the IMF's pessimism over global economic growth and particularly its outlook for Spain's debt. EU Stoxx 50 -0.5%, London -0.4%, Paris -0.4%, Frankfurt -0.6%, Madrid -0.9%, Milan -0.75%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 AM

  • Asian shares mostly rise, with China boosted by the PBOC's latest capital injection into the...

    Asian shares mostly rise, with China boosted by the PBOC's latest capital injection into the money markets, although Japan fell on concerns about corporate earnings. Japan -1.1%, Hong Kong +1%, China +1.9%, India +0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 AM
